intro: Richardella afzelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with upright stems and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Richardella afzelii thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
